ygData.subject: Re: You regain concentration and continue casting...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Mark Stokes [mailto:Mark.Stokes@tddny.fujitsu.com]On Behalf Of mstokes Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 11:55 AM To: eq_wizards@onelist.com Subject:
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Mark Stokes [mailto:Mark.Stokes@...]On Behalf Of
mstokes
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 11:55 AM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] You regain concentration and continue
casting...


From: mstokes <mstokes@...>

>
> Any wizards out there with high dex (gnomes start with 85 dex I believe)
> care to comment on this?

I'm a gnomish Wizard, I also put 5 of my bonus points into dex (90?), and 3
into wisdom (70). It doesn't seem to matter what is hitting me when I
recover. I've recovered while being hit by deep reds and Decaying skels. I
tend to recover most while being hit by blues, but I have attacked/been
attacked by blues more than anything else. Anyway, I pulled this from the
manual.

Very interesting...... I'm a lvl 12 Gnome Wizard with dex of 89 and I have
*never* been able to continue a spell against anything. Perhaps it's my
relatively low level?

Xorgan
